business.headline: Adani Green, Adani Ports, Adani Transmission: Why Adani group shares are fallingAdani Enterprises bore the brunt of the sell-off, falling 23% during the session. Adani Ports and Special Economic Zone (APSEZ) dropped 21%, while Adani Energy Solutions and Adani Transmission both declined by 20%.
Gautam Adani faces bribery charges. 5 things you need to know Gautam Adani and seven others have been accused of paying Rs 2,029 crore in bribes to secure solar power contracts between 2020 and 2024.

NTPC Green Energy IPO GMP dips: Is it worth subscribing? 3 risks to considerNTPC Green Energy IPO: The price band has been set between Rs 102 and Rs 108 per share, with a minimum application size of 138 shares, amounting to Rs 14,904 for retail investors.

entertainment.headline: House of cards actor Kevin Spacey given bail, what happens to #metoo now?From American Beauty to House of Cards, one of the most lauded actors of his generation, Kevin Spacey has a tainted reputation. In a new turn, the Oscar-winning actor "strenuously" denied allegations of sexual assault against him and got bail. Watch to know more

Images of Nayantara wearing sandals inside Tirupati temple sparks outrage against newlywed coupleAfter the grand wedding between Nayantara and Vignesh, the couple went to the Tirupati temple to offer prayers.

However, images of Nayantara wearing footwear inside the temple area has sparked outrage among the devotees against the couple.

While Vignesh was spotted walking barefoot, Nayantara was seen wearing sandals, which caused a massive uproar amongst devotees in the area.

Temple authorities issued a clarification saying it was permitted for devotees to wear footwear in that area.

Cannes Film Festival 2022: Deepika, Aishwarya walk the red carpet; Indian pavilion inauguratedThe 75th annual Cannes Film Festival began on May 17. Aishwarya Rai Bachchan and Deepika Padukone walked the red carpet on Day 3 of the 10-day film festival. 

On the second day, May 18, Union Minister for I&B, Youth Affairs & Sports, Anurag Thakur, inaugurated the India Pavilion at the Cannes Film Festival. The special event was also attended by several Indian celebrities, including Deepika Padukone, R. Madhavan, Nawazuddin Siddiqui, Tamannaah Bhatia and others.

Deepika Padukone, who is part of the Cannes 2022 jury, talked about Indian films at the event and said that she believes there will be a day when Cannes will be in India.
Disco king Bappi Lahiri passes away at 69 Singer-composer Bappi Lahiri passed away on Wednesday, February 16, at a Mumbai hospital. He was 69.

Andheri court summons Shilpa Shetty, Shamita, their mother Sunanda The Andheri court has issued summons to Bollywood actress Shilpa Shetty, her sister Shamita and their mother Sunanda over non-repayment of loan.

general news.headline: Opposition's 'nexus' jibe at PM Modi after Adani's US indictment, BJP countersSenior Congress leader Jairam Ramesh said the indictment of Gautam Adani and others by the US Securities and Exchange Commission validates his party's call for a Joint Parliamentary Committee investigation.

Smear campaign: India on Canada media report claiming PM knew of Nijjar killingThe government rubbished the allegations levelled by a Canadian newspaper, calling such media reports "ludicrous" and said such "smear campaigns like this only further damage the already strained ties" between both countries.

Karnataka Minister slammed for reaction to student questioning his KannadaThe Karnataka BJP condemned the state education minister for instructing his department to take action against a school student. Madhu Bangarappa was reportedly questioned by the student why he wasn't speaking in Kannada despite being the state education minister.

Hike in charges at Bengaluru government hospitals, health minister defends moveBengaluru Medical College hospitals double fees for OPD registration, admission, and more. Health Minister Dinesh Gundu Rao defends the hike, calling it a necessary adjustment after years of unchanged rates.

Diljit Dosanjh jokes with fans watching his Ahmedabad concert from hotel balconyDiljit Dosanjh paused his Ahmedabad concert to joke with fans watching from a hotel balcony. The video went viral on social media, with hilarious comments about the hotel possibly charging more for the view.

Tribal woman assaulted in Odisha, human faeces stuffed in her mouthA 20-year-old tribal woman in Odisha's Jurabandh village was assaulted by a fellow villager, who she alleged forced her to consume human faeces.

AR Rahman divorce: Lawyer dismisses any link to bassist Mohini Dey's separationAR Rahman and Saira Banu announced their separation after 29 years of marriage. On the same day, bassist Mohini Dey also shared her divorce announcement. Saira's lawyer denied any connection between the two.

As he prepares to return to his favourite hunting ground, millions of fans are eager to see the 'King' reign supreme in Australia once more. Can he defy the odds and inspire India to a historic hat-trick Down Under?

Why Nirmala Sitharaman, Piyush Goyal would like RBI to slash interest ratesThe Union ministers flagged high interest rates as a dampener for growth at a time inflation, excessive rains and shrinking incomes have severely hit urban consumption

Bangladesh minorities victimised: Report on 100 days exposes Yunus governmentMinorities, including Hindus, have suffered in the first 100 days of the Muhammad Yunus government in Bangladesh, reveals a report by Transparency International. The report cites 2,010 incidents of communal violence under the post-Hasina regime and the lack of effort to identify and punish the perpetrators.

19 kg gold worth Rs 13.6 crore robbed in Telangana bank heistBurglars steal 19 kg of gold worth Rs 13.6 crore from a public sector bank in Telangana's Warangal district. They also damaged the CCTV footage and stole the DVR, erasing any potential evidence of the crime.

Coachella 2025: Lady Gaga to headline; Jennie, Lisa to perform as solo artistsThe Coachella 2025 lineup is out. Indian artist Humankind joins global icons like Lady Gaga and BLACKPINK members Lisa and Jennie.

Court asks Himachal to close 18 state-run hotels: Burden on exchequerA single-judge bench of Justice Ajay Mohan Goel ordered the corporation to shut down the properties by November 25. The corporation's managing director was asked to ensure the enforcement of the order.

Zomato CEO hiring Chief of Staff, wants employee to pay Rs 20 lakh in first yearZomato CEO Deepinder Goyal has announced a job opening for a Chief of Staff position. The role comes with a striking condition: no salary in the first year, and a requirement for the selected candidate to pay Rs 20 lakh as a fee.

BJP-Sena-NCP to retain Maharashtra, edge for NDA in Jharkhand: Exit pollsExit polls predicted a win for the BJP-Sena-NCP alliance in Maharashtra, while the BJP-led NDA is likely to be in a neck-and-neck fight with the JMM-Congress alliance in Jharkhand.

Pic: Queen Of Tears star Kim Soo-hyun's first look from Knock Off outSouth Korean actor Kim Soo-hyun's first look from the new drama, Knock Off, is out. The show will depict his transformation from an ordinary office worker to a leader in the counterfeit market following the 1997 Asian financial crisis.

Bumrah will lead India in Rohit Sharma's absence in the opening Test of the five-match series against the Aussies at the Perth Stadium.

Guardiola to extend Manchester City contract for one more season: ReportsPep Guardiola will extend his Manchester City tenure until 2026, ending speculation about his future. Despite recent setbacks, the Spanish manager aims to lead City back to glory, solidifying his legacy as one of football's greatest tacticians.

India clinch third Women's Asian Champions Trophy after 1-0 win over ChinaIndia Women's Hockey Team claimed their third Asian Champions Trophy title with a hard-fought 1-0 victory over China in Bihar, as Deepika's decisive third-quarter strike sealed the win in a thrilling and closely contested final.

Recapping India's history in Australia in Border Gavaskar TrophyAUS vs IND: India are all set to face Australia in a five-match Test series, starting November 22. India have won two out of seven Test series in the Border-Gavaskar Trophy on Australian soil.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
